snippet: Upstart candidates are robbing the Israeli opposition of the chance to claim the prime minister's seat - and robbing Israelis of an alternative to Benjamin Netanyahu.
abstract: Upstart candidates are robbing the Israeli opposition of the chance to claim the prime minister's seat - and robbing Israelis of an alternative to Benjamin Netanyahu.
lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM - Many of Israel's allies appear to dislike Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Some - including Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority, and, it has been rumored, President Barack Obama - also entertain fantasies about seeing him replaced. Yet the next election, whenever it is, will probably make clear that, like it or not, Netanyahu is the only viable candidate for the job.
